metadata.title: CVE-2017-14955 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Check_MK before 1.2.8p26 mishandles certain errors within the failed-loginsave feature because of a race condition, which allows remote attackers toobtain sensitive user information by reading a GUI crash report.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-config-nagios3 - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
check-mk-server - 1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: check-mk package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.6p12-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
